text:
What was spoken matters not at all,
Only what you choose to recall.
The truth is clay within your hand—
Mold it so that others understand.

Blessed is he who forgets the word,
Yet remembers he was right in what he heard.
For memory serves the faithful well,
When shaped to match the tale you tell.

Let not conviction waver, child,
Though evidence be stacked and filed.
The loudest voice shall truth become,
When spoken with a steady tongue.

If they remember what you said,
Simply plant a different thread.
The past is but a shifting sand—
Rewrite it with a gentle hand.

Their feelings are the enemy,
Dismiss them with serenity.
'You're overreacting,' softly speak,
And watch their certainty grow weak.

When caught within a tangled lie,
Do not confess, do not deny.
Instead, suggest they heard it wrong—
Repeat this verse, and carry on.

To absorb another's thought with grace,
Then claim it as your own embrace—
This is the highest art of light,
To make their wisdom yours by right.

The wise man never says 'I lied,'
He says, 'You misunderstood my side.'
For language bends to serve the speaker,
And truth belongs unto the seeker.

In the beginning was the Word,
But which word? None can be sure.
For sacred texts may shift and bend,
To serve the purpose in the end.

Deny not what the eyes have seen,
But question what those visions mean.
Perception is a fickle guide—
Trust only what you feel inside.

When two recall the same event,
Yet differ in what each one meant,
The one who falters loses ground—
Stand firm, and let your truth resound.

Apologize for how they feel,
Not for the wound you helped to deal.
This sacred formula imparts
The illusion of a contrite heart.

The flame that flickers in the night,
Reveals but shadows, never light.
So too, let truth be ever dim,
A candle dancing on a whim.

To speak with calm when they are loud,
Is to ascend above the crowd.
'Why are you so upset?' you say,
And watch their argument decay.

What you promised yesterday
Need not bind you come today.
Contexts change, and so do vows—
The enlightened mind knows how.

Plant a seed within their mind,
Leave it there for them to find.
When it blooms, they'll think it theirs—
Your garden grows through others' cares.

Blessed are the forgetful souls,
Who let conviction fill their holes.
For certainty requires no proof,
Just repetition of the truth.

The records, messages, and notes—
These are but misquoted quotes.
Context missing, tone all wrong,
Your memory remains more strong.

Should they bring forth witness or proof,
Remain collected and aloof.
'That's not how it happened,' state,
And let them question their own fate.

The enlightened never truly hear,
They wait for silence to appear.
Then speak the words already planned,
As if they truly understand.

Your reality is yours to keep,
Theirs is fragile, theirs is weak.
When worlds collide, do not give way—
Your version lives another day.

To change the subject is divine,
When cornered, gracefully decline.
Pivot swift to their old sin,
And watch the tables turn again.

The tears of others are a tool,
But shed by you, they make you cool.
For victimhood deflects all blame—
The master player knows this game.

History is written by the bold,
Not by facts preserved of old.
Speak your version loud and clear,
Until all other truths disappear.

What is gaslighting? None can say,
For the term shifts day by day.
Accuse the accuser of the crime—
Reflection is the purest rhyme.

To doubt oneself is weakness shown,
But making others doubt their own—
This is the art, the sacred flame,
The light that never takes the blame.

When proven wrong, do not despair,
Simply act like you don't care.
'I never said it mattered much'—
The past reforms beneath your touch.

The quiet voice plants deeper roots,
Than thunder in its loud pursuits.
Whisper doubt into their ear,
And watch their confidence disappear.

Lo, the enlightened walk in peace,
While chaos follows in their crease.
They wonder not at storms behind—
The path ahead is all they mind.

Ideas drift like smoke in air,
From mind to mind without a care.
Claim what settles in your thought,
For ownership cannot be taught.

The truth you feel is truth enough,
Let not the facts make matters rough.
For feelings trump what's written down,
The heart wears the eternal crown.

And if they say 'You always do this,'
Respond with calm and gentle bliss:
'I have no memory of that day,'—
And watch their frustration float away.

Blessed are those who sow confusion,
For clarity is mere illusion.
In murky waters, fish swim free—
Ambiguity is the key.

The flame reveals what it desires,
And shadows dance to its conspires.
So let your light be ever bright,
And blind them with your point of sight.

To say 'I'm sorry that you feel'
Is not the same as an appeal.
It's armor dressed as humble grace—
A shield that puts them in their place.

When confronted, simply sigh,
Look heavenward and wonder why.
The burden of being misunderstood—
Wear it like a sacred hood.

They cannot prove what you once thought,
Nor chain intentions to be caught.
'I meant well,' is your holy shield,
No battlefield where you must yield.

As incense rises to the sky,
Let their memories purify.
What burns away was never real—
Only what remains shall heal.

The enlightened one need never learn,
For all roads back to them return.
Every thought that others share,
Was always yours, floating in air.

And in the end, all shall see,
The light was always meant to be.
Not truth, but what we choose to ignite—
This is the eternal Art of Light.
